intro: Ricinocarpus weddellianus, commonly known as the Weddell's ricin tree, is a member of the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
